content.question: Which of the following series can be used with the comparison test to determine whether the series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator 4 plus sine n, and denominator n squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> converges or diverges?

choices.label: <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction 7 over n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator 3, and denominator n squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator 5, and denominator n squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator 5, and denominator n cubed, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator 5, and denominator n squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
